overview_of_class: This course addresses family relationships and their communication processes or how members' interactions create and maintain families across the years. Relying on a framework of family functions the course focuses on how family members accomplish the following: develop communication patters that affect future generations, manage members' intimacy and conflict patterns, move through developmental stages over time while managing developmental and unpredictable stressors, and improve their interaction patterns.
name: Family Communication
title: SoC COMM_ST 345-0-20 Family Communication

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course addresses family relationships and their communication processes or how members' interactions create and maintain families across the years. Relying on a framework of family functions the course focuses on how family members accomplish the following: develop communication patters that affect future generations, manage members' intimacy and conflict patterns, move through developmental stages over time while managing developmental and unpredictable stressors, and improve their interaction patterns.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Galvin, K.W., Braithwaite, Bylund (2015) Family Communication: Cohesion and Change. Routledge. New York.

subject: COMM_ST
